conclusion: The internal resistance of the silicon photocell can be determined by finding the point where the two lines intersect, which represents the open-circuit voltage (Voc) and the short-circuit current (Isc) of the photocell.
From the graph, the Voc is approximately 3.6V and the Isc is approximately 0.3A.
The internal resistance (r) can be calculated using the formula r = Voc / Isc. Therefore, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 3.6V / 0.3A = 12 ohms.
